newsitem.title: UK: Barclays union says strike ballot underway.
newsitem.headline: Barclays union says strike ballot underway.

text.p: Some 40,000 Barclays Plc staff are casting their votes on Monday in a strike action ballot on a new pay structure, BIFU, one of the unions representing staff at the banking giant, said.
The ballot, being conducted by unions UNiFI and BIFU, asks members if they are prepared to take industrial action including two- or three-day strikes and a ban on overtime, BIFU said in a statement.
Balloting is due to finish on July 24.

The unions, which together represent more than three quarters of all Barclays staff, oppose Barclays' plan to impose a new pay and grading structure based on performance which will result in a pay and pensions freeze for over half the staff.
The motive behind the company's plan is to cut staff costs and to cap on staff's potential earnings, the unions say.
"To cap pay at a time when Barclays are making 2.35 billion stg profit is immoral," Jim Lowe, assistant secretary at BIFU, said.
Barclays shares were six pence lower at 1231-1/2 by 0925 GMT.

The threat of industrial action by one of Britain's biggest high street banks has come early in the new Labour government's first term of office and as British Airways Plc braced itself for a 72-hour strike by cabin crew starting this Wednesday.
